Best Student Credit Cards in Hong Kong
Are you a full-time university or tertiary institution student looking for credit card deals? You are not alone. Students nowadays have all sorts of expenses from tuition fees, exchange programmes to social networking. There are many student credit cards that offer student-specific rewards such as cash rebate on tuition fee payment. Also, if you hold a student credit card early, you will be able to establish a credit history earlier for yourself.
HSBC Student Credit Card - HSBC Visa Gold Card (Student)
HSBC offers HSBC Visa Gold Card that is tailor-made for students. It provides a wide range of rewards in your school life from tuition fee payment, dining, entertainment to online and overseas spending. From now to 2 March 2020, you can enjoy up to 2.4% RewardCash rebate on your tuition fee payment to designated education institutions via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking App or Personal Internet Banking, at a maximum rebate amount of HK$400 RewardCash. In addition to RewardCash rebate on tuition fee payment, you will also enjoy up to 2.4% RewardCash rebate on online and overseas spending by registering for “Red Hot Online and Overseas Spending Rewards” with your HSBC Visa Gold Card.
This HSBC student credit card also offers you exclusive discounts and privileges at a host of merchants. You can enjoy 15% off regular-priced tickets at CGV Cinemas, year-round hotel dining offers at selected hotels such as Harbour Plaza 8 Degrees, The Langham and more, and HK$30 instant discount at the Eslite bookstore for a single transaction of HK$300 or above and HK$300 spending rebate for transactions made on the Cathay Pacific App via Apple Pay.
Citibank Student Credit Card - Citi Clear Card (Student)
If you are a full-time student of any degree/diploma program in an eligible tertiary institution in Hong Kong, you can apply for Citi Clear Student Card. It offers an array of online shopping and entertainment privileges to students in Hong Kong. You can enjoy a 2% cash rebate on online spending in foreign currency and a 0.4% cash rebate on other spendings. To provide you with peace of mind, Citi will send you SMS alerts whenever your online transaction reaches HK$500. With this Citibank Student Credit Card, you can also enjoy priority bookings on entertainment shows and buy 1-get-1-free movie tickets every Friday to Sunday.
Student Credit Card Promotions & Offers
No Minimum Income Requirements
Many student credit cards including Hang Seng enJoy Card, WeWa Union Pay Card, Citi Clear Card, AEON UnionPay Credit Card and EarnMORE UnionPay Card do not have minimum income requirement. However, students are required to submit proof of student status.
Annual Fee Waiver
Some credit cards offer an annual fee waiver. For example, Hang Seng enJoy Card offers perpetual annual fee waiver while WeWa Union Pay Card and Citi Clear Card offer a 2-year and 1-year annual fee waiver. In general, cardholders can usually request for an annual fee waiver if your credit card is actively in use.
Rewards
Credit cards offer a host of rewards from cash rebate to air miles and more. For example, WeWa Union Pay Card offers up to 4% Cash Rebate for spending in specific categories (“Travel”, “Cinema”, “Karaoke” and “Theme Park”) throughout the year. With EarnMORE UnionPay Card, cardholders can earn up to 2% Cash Rebate for eligible transactions including Octopus AAVS. Citi Clear Card even offers Buy-1-Get-1-Free 3D and 2D movie tickets from every Friday to Sunday.
How to Apply for a Student Credit Card?
Most banks require the student credit card applicants to be full-time University or Tertiary Institution students
Applicants have to be over the age of 18
Most banks do not have a minimum annual income requirement
You will have to provide proper documentation such as identification proof, residential address proof, and a valid Tertiary student identity card
University Student Credit Cards V.S. Student Credit Cards From Finance Institutions
Co-branded credit cards for students are usually designed to provide offers within the campus only. Also, part of the spending will be donated to the related institution for school development. Student credit cards from finance institutions provide a host of everyday benefits. For example, with WeWa Union Pay Card, cardholders can enjoy up to 4% Cash Rebate for spending in specific categories (“Travel”, “Cinema”, “Karaoke” and “Theme Park”).

Student Credit Card Welcome Offers
Credit cards offer an array of welcome offers if cardholders can meet the spending requirements set out by the card issuer within a specified time frame. For example, Citi Clear Card offers HK$200 cash rebate as welcome offers if cardholders can accumulate spending of HK$2,500 or above within the first 2 months from the date of card issuance.
Frequently Asked Questions
Which student credit cards are the most popular?
Popular student credit cards include: WeWa UnionPay Diamond Card (4% cash back on travel spending) and HSBC Visa Gold Card for Students (2.4% RewardCash on tuition fee payment). Apply on MoneySmart now for extra rewards!
How to check if a credit card accepts student applicants?
Most major banks offer student credit cards such as HSBC, Hang Seng, Citi, etc. However, please note that some applications are only open to students from specified institutions.
Can you use a credit card to pay off student loans?
Yes. With designated credit cards, you can even earn air miles or cash rebate for paying school fees. With Hang Seng enJoy Card, you can get HK$1 Cash Dollars for every HK$200, i.e. 0.5% rebate.
What banks offer student credit cards?
There are many banks offering student credit cards. For example, Hang Seng enJoy Card, WeWa Union Pa Card, Citi Clear Card, AEON UnionPay Credit Card, HSBC Visa Gold Card and EarnMORE UnionPay Card.
Can I get a student credit card without a job?
Most student credit cards do not have a minimum income requirement. However, please note that some credit cards are only applicable to students from selected institutions.
